title.narrative: Conférence internationale sur l'emploi des jeunes en Afrique subsaharienne
Youth Employment in Sub-Saharan Africa Conference

description.narrative:
This project will provide funding to the International Conference on Youth Employment in Sub-Saharan Africa (YESSA), which will bring together national, regional, and multilateral policymakers, African researchers, and think tanks to address youth employment issues in the region.
Conference attendees will discuss opportunities and challenges to youth employment, explore potential policy options, and inform the development of a policy-oriented research agenda grounded in local realities. There will be parallel sessions with research papers, presentations on programs, panel discussions, and keynote speakers from sub-Saharan Africa and North Africa.
The YESSA conference results will include: -a critical review of programs and policy initiatives for youth employment in Africa -a new perspective on the importance of evidence-based policy informed by quality local research -a list of knowledge gaps for improved youth employment policies -foundations for a strategic alliance of local think tanks, researchers, and policy actors on the issue of youth employment -an African research and policy network on youth employment and -a conference report.
These items will inform a special session of the African Union's Conference of Labour Ministers in Windhoek, Namibia, in April 2014. Labour ministers are expected to adopt a new declaration and a new plan of action for job promotion in Africa. It will feed into the Extraordinary Session of the Assembly of the African Union in September 2014. This session will mark the 10th year of the Ouaga Declaration on Employment and Poverty Alleviation in Africa.
These windows of policy opportunity are expected to reinforce African commitments to develop integrated economic and social policies and effect reforms, promote investment and entrepreneurship, private-public partnerships, and create an enabling environment for increased production and decent employment opportunities.
